alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BOURBON AND NORTHERN VERNON COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM CDT... At 920 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fulton to 6 miles south of Moran. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Nevada, Fort Scott, Marmaton, Bronson, Uniontown, Fulton, Redfield, Richards, Mapleton, Deerfield, Metz, Stotesbury, Horton, Harding, Pawnee Station, Hiattville, Petersburg, Hammond, Devon and Garland. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 92 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Kansas...and west central Missouri.
